data.title: Where was Secret Invasion filmed? Guide to all the Locations
data.meta_description: Guide to all the Filming Locations of Secret Invasion - The New Skrullos City and all the places where the Marvel series were filmed in England.
data.text:
Posted by Ra Moon

Although the series is largely set in Russia, Secret Invasion was primarily filmed in the United Kingdom.

The six-episode series revolves around Nick Fury (once again played by Samuel L. Jackson), who stumbles upon a nefarious plot orchestrated by a rogue faction of Skrulls, determined to take over Earth through strategic infiltration and manipulation.

Based on the popular Marvel comic book, the cast also includes Game Of Thrones star Emilia Clarke as G'iah, Kingsley Ben-Adir (Peaky Blinders, The OA) as rebel Skrull leader, Gravik, and Ben Mendelsohn (Bloodline, The Outsider) as Fury's ally, Talos.

Welcome to our spoiler-free guide to all the filming locations of Secret Invasion. We will be updating and expanding this report every week as new locations are revealed.

Secret Invasion Locations

The night scenes in present-day Moscow from the first episode, "Resurrection", were filmed at Dean Clough in Halifax, West Yorkshire.

Built in the mid-19th century, this complex was a group of Victorian carpet mills until production ceased in 1983.

Today, the area has been redeveloped as a shopping area and arts venue.

(You can open all the locations on Google Maps by clicking on the links below in the captions ↴)

Image courtesy of Disney and Google Maps

MI6 agent Sonya Falsworth (played by Olivia Colman) has a chat with Fury at the Hatfield House library.

Located in Hertfordshire, you've seen this magnificent Jacobean-style country house in many other movies and shows including Bridgerton, Queen Charlotte, The Great, and Taboo.

Image courtesy of Disney - Map

Secret Invasion's New Skrullos city

New Skrullos, located in the show 312 km southwest of Moscow, is actually the old Shredded Wheat Factory in Welwyn Garden City.

Built in 1926, this historic complex was home to the American biscuit company Nabisco, until it was closed in 2008.

As you can see, the cooling tower of the abandoned nuclear power plant and a chimney were added via CGI.

Image courtesy of Disney and Google Maps

As Leeds Live revealed, the Moscow scenes with G'iah were filmed in the city center of Leeds, Yorkshire.

The production was shooting between Greek Street and Bond Court around the Dakota Hotel.

Image courtesy of Disney and Google Maps

The tunnel entrance where Maria follows G'iah was also filmed at Dean Clough in Halifax.

Image courtesy of Disney - Map

The beginning of the Unity Day sequence was filmed in Kensington Gardens, London.

Pictured is Queen Anne's Alcove, a historic landmark built in 1705.

Image courtesy of Disney - Map

As the local press reported, Halifax's monumental Piece Hall doubled as Vossoyedineniye Square, with plenty of CGI thrown in.

The only surviving Georgian cloth hall in the world, it symbolizes the paramount role of the handwoven textile trade in the pre-industrial economy of Yorkshire's West Riding from the Middle Ages to the early 19th century.

Image courtesy of Disney and Google Maps

The Skrull meeting in the second episode, "Promises", was held at the Four Seasons Hotel London at Ten Trinity Square in London.

The previous scene with Nick and Talos on the train appears to have been filmed at the Kelenföld railway station in Budapest.

Image courtesy of Disney - Maps: London / Budapest

The room where the Skrulls experiment with a new weapon in the second episode, "Promises", looks like the Kelenföld Power Plant in Budapest, Hungary.

This location may be a set built at the studios, inspired by this impressive Art Deco space built between 1927 and 1929.

Kelenföld was abandoned in 2006, but today it has become a tourist attraction and part-time filming location.

Image courtesy of Disney and Andreas - Map

The emergency security summit in London was filmed at the Senate House Library in London, located near the The British Museum.

Image courtesy of Disney - Map

The empty bar where Fury meets with United States Air Force Colonel James 'Rhodey' Rhodes (played by Don Cheadle) is the Berners Tavern in Fitzrovia, London.

Located inside the London Edition Hotel, Berners Tavern is Michelin-starred chef Jason Atherton restaurant.

Image courtesy of Disney - Map

Fury's house is a 70's modernist home named Waterside House located in Bromley, Kent.

Image courtesy of Disney - Map

In the third episode, "Betrayed", G'iah drives across Lambeth Bridge in London.

Image courtesy of Disney - Map

The fictional London Portrait Gallery is a section of the 007 stage at Pinewood Studios.

The studio work for the series was also done at the Longcross Studios in Surrey.

Image courtesy of Disney - Maps: Pinewood / Longcross

The manor house where Nick Fury and Talos go to confront Bob is the Stoke Court in Stoke Poges, located near Pinewood Studios.

Image courtesy of Disney - Map

According to MCU Location Scout, the temple in the fourth episode, "Beloved", is the St. Etheldreda Church in Old Hatfield, Hertfordshire.

Image courtesy of Disney - Map

Stay tuned on this page, we will be updating and expanding this report every week as new locations are revealed!

Can you help to improve this article about the filming locations of Secret Invasion? To complete and correct this report, any feedback, info, or images that you may have are more than welcome, thank you!

NOTICE: If you’re using this information on your website, please credit and link to this page as a source.

*****

4 comments:

1- Anonymous - Jun 22, 2023, 6:04 PM

"Located 312 km southwest of Moscow, New Skrullos is the old Shredded Wheat Factory in Welwyn Garden City" -- you might wanna fix that? You're out by over 2000km.

2- Anonymous - Jul 8, 2023, 1:19 AM

The outside of the house that Nick Fury and Talos travel to in episode 3 to confront 'Bob' is Stoke Court in Stoke Poges - not far from Pinewood Studios. It used to be a conference center and research laboratory for Bayer. It has since appeared in several productions including Killing Eve.

3- Anonymous - Aug 4, 2023, 3:10 PM

In episode two, the train that Nick Fury and Talos discussing is actually in Budapest (near the old train cemetery and Kelenföld train station).

The water tower in the background is quite famous.

4- Anonymous - Aug 25, 2023, 7:55 PM

Platform for political war again, hence the title, how convenient. Capital P equals evil.

Ra Moon
